page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The area consists of farmland, mainly pasture some of which has been cultivated. Both cattle and sheep are kept here. The fields are surrounded by high hedges many on top of the traditional Devon banks - soil banks usually about a metre high. Some of these hedges contain well developed trees and there are small patches of woodland. The roads in the area are narrow and set deep between high banks. In the west of this area is Wimbleball lake, a large reservoir administered by the South West Water Authority. The roads near the lake have been improved to give easy access for tourists. Buildings in the area consist mainly of farmhouses with a few isolated cottages. Some of these have been modernised but many are in a bad state of repair and some are derelict.
